deterministic_tests.label: Deterministic tests
deterministic_tests.description: Y/y: rich built-in deterministic checks (mostly configuration). P/p: some facilities, but real coverage needs custom test constructs. N/n: no meaningful built-in deterministic checks, effectively only LLM-as-a-judge style evaluation.
deterministic_tests.why_it_matters: Reduces flakiness and makes regressions easier to catch in CI.

caching.label: Caching
caching.description: Y/y: built-in caching is automatic or simple to enable. P/p: possible, but you are effectively building a construct on top. N/n: no practical built-in caching path.
caching.why_it_matters: Lowers cost and iteration time during prompt and test development.

tool_call_validation.label: Tool call validation
tool_call_validation.description: Y/y: built-in validation of tool/function calls with automatic pass/fail checks. P/p: partial support, but key validation logic is custom or path-limited. N/n: no built-in validation workflow; logs/OTel alone do not count.
tool_call_validation.why_it_matters: Prevents silent failures in agent workflows that rely on tool use.

run_comparison.label: Run comparison
run_comparison.description: Y/y: built-in run-to-run comparison over time. P/p: some comparison exists but is limited or manual. N/n: no native run comparison; requires custom scripts.
run_comparison.why_it_matters: Helps isolate regressions and quantify improvements over time.

opentelemetry_tracing.label: OpenTelemetry tracing
opentelemetry_tracing.description: Y/y: built-in OTel tracing can be enabled/configured directly. P/p: OTel is possible but needs meaningful custom plumbing or only works in narrow paths. N/n: no practical built-in OTel tracing path.
opentelemetry_tracing.why_it_matters: Enables cross-system debugging and shared telemetry standards.

chat_threads.label: Chat threads
chat_threads.description: Y/y: built-in multi-turn thread/session testing. P/p: thread support exists but is constrained or indirect. N/n: effectively single-turn unless you build orchestration.
chat_threads.why_it_matters: Better reflects production chatbot and assistant behavior.

red_teaming.label: Red teaming
red_teaming.description: Y/y: first-class built-in red-team/adversarial workflows. P/p: some attack/safety checks exist but workflow coverage is incomplete. N/n: no native red-team flow; custom harness required.
red_teaming.why_it_matters: Surfaces failure modes and policy violations before deployment.

model_comparison.label: Model comparison
model_comparison.description: Y/y: built-in side-by-side or scored comparison across models/providers/runs. P/p: comparison exists but only in limited paths. N/n: requires user-built scripts/pipelines.
model_comparison.why_it_matters: Supports model selection and migration decisions with evidence.

web_ui.label: Web UI
web_ui.description: Y/y: built-in UI shows current results, past/history, and comparison. P/p: built-in UI exists but misses at least one of those three. N/n: no built-in UI for eval results.
web_ui.why_it_matters: Makes debugging and collaboration easier for mixed technical teams.
